Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Explain the function of nouns, pronouns, verbs, adjectives, and adverbs in general and their functions in particular sentences.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Form and use regular and irregular plural nouns.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use abstract nouns (e.g., childhood).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Form and use regular and irregular verbs.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Form and use the simple (e.g., I walked; I walk; I will walk) verb tenses.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ensure subject-verb and pronoun-antecedent agreement.*

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Form and use comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs, and choose between them depending on what is to be modified.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use coordinating and subordinating conjunctions.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Capitalize appropriate words in titles.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use commas in addresses.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use commas and quotation marks in dialogue.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Form and use possessives.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use conventional spelling for high-frequency and other studied words and for adding suffixes to base words (e.g., sitting, smiled, cries, happiness).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use spelling patterns and generalizations (e.g., word families, position-based spellings, syllable patterns, ending rules, meaningful word parts) in writing words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Choose words and phrases for effect.*

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Recognize and observe differences between the conventions of spoken and written standard English.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning word and phrases based on grade 3 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known affix is added to a known word (e.g., agreeable/disagreeable, comfortable/uncomfortable, care/careless, heat/preheat).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., company, companion).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Distinguish the literal and nonliteral meanings of words and phrases in context (e.g., take steps).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe people who are friendly or helpful).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Distinguish shades of meaning among related words that describe states of mind or degrees of certainty (e.g., knew, believed, suspected, heard, wondered).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate conversational, general academic, and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal spatial and temporal relationships (e.g., After dinner that night we went looking for them).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Identify and know the meaning of the most common prefixes and derivational suffixes.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Decode words with common Latin suffixes.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Decode multisyllable words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Read grade-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine the main idea of a text; recount the key details and explain how they support the main idea.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text, using language that pertains to time, sequence, and cause/effect.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 3 topic or subject area.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use text features and search tools (e.g., key words, sidebars, hyperlinks) to locate information relevant to a given topic efficiently.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the author of a text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use information gained from illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs) and the words in a text to demonstrate understanding of the text (e.g., where, when, why, and how key events occur).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe the logical connection between particular sentences and paragraphs in a text (e.g., comparison, cause/effect, first/second/third in a sequence).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Compare and contrast the most important points and key details presented in two texts on the same topic.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, at the high end of the grades 2–3 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Recount stories, including fables, folktales, and myths from diverse cultures; determine the central message, lesson, or moral and explain how it is conveyed through key details in the text.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Describe characters in a story (e.g., their traits, motivations, or feelings) and explain how their actions contribute to the sequence of events.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, distinguishing literal from nonliteral language.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Refer to parts of stories, dramas, and poems when writing or speaking about a text, using terms such as chapter, scene, and stanza; describe how each successive part builds on earlier sections.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Distinguish their own point of view from that of the narrator or those of the characters.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Explain how specific aspects of a text’s illustrations contribute to what is conveyed by the words in a story (e.g., create mood, emphasize aspects of a character or setting).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Compare and contrast the themes, settings, and plots of stories written by the same author about the same or similar characters (e.g., in books from a series).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Range of Reading and Complexity of Text
Description: 10. By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, at the high end of the grades 2–3 text complexity band independently and proficiently.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 3 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask questions to check understanding of information presented, stay on topic, and link their comments to the remarks of others.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Determine the main ideas and supporting details of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Ask and answer questions about information from a speaker, offering appropriate elaboration and detail.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking clearly at an understandable pace.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Create engaging audio recordings of stories or poems that demonstrate fluid reading at an understandable pace; add visual displays when appropriate to emphasize or enhance certain facts or details.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Speak in complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification. (See grade 3 Language standards 1 and 3 on page 26 for specific expectations.)

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write opinion pieces on familiar topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Introduce the topic or text they are writing about, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure that lists reasons.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Provide reasons that support the opinion.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use linking words and phrases (e.g., because, therefore, since, for example) to connect opinion and reasons.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Provide a concluding statement or section.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Introduce a topic and group related information together; include illustrations when useful to aiding comprehension.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, and details.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use linking words and phrases (e.g., also, another, and, more, but) to connect ideas within categories of information.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Provide a concluding statement or section.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Establish a situation and introduce a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use dialogue and descriptions of actions, thoughts, and feelings to develop experiences and events or show the response of characters to situations.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Use temporal words and phrases to signal event order.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Provide a sense of closure.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: With guidance and support from adults, produce writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task and purpose. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grade 3 on page 29.)

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (using keyboarding skills) as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge about a topic.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Subcategory: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Description: Recall information from experiences or gather information from print and digital sources; take brief notes on sources and sort evidence into provided categories.

Subject: Lang/Arts
Description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.
